post_text: Congratulations to Lion Nancy Kohler!!! On June 5th, the Seaford Lions (NY) held its Annual Installation Dinner. This year Nancy was awarded a Melvin Jones Fellowship. The Melvin Jones Fellowship (MJF) Award is the highest recognition from the Lions Clubs International Foundation. It is given to members who have rendered outstanding community services. Nancy for example has transported over 200 live corneas for the Long Islang Eye Bank. She does this transportation at all hours of the day and night. It is a total volunteer effort. She delivers these corneas to hospitals throughout NY. Nancy was also president of the Seaford Lions or the last two years. Nancy makes us all proud to be Lions.

We have a winner! Every year the Seaford Lions Club members stand outside local establishments selling chances to help send diabetic children to a special camp. At this camp, youngsters can learn how to deal with their ailment. Lions International is dedicated to ending world blindness. In the US, diabetes is a major cause of blindness. The Seaford Lions are taking proactive approach by teaching these children when they are young.
The Lions raffled off a vacuum donated by Seaford Vac and Sew. Pictured here are Diabetes Camp Chairperson Lion Dr. Lisl Kast, the winner Donna Jebaily (her husband James bought the winning ticket) and Lion Pat Patel the proprietor of Seaford Vac and Sew. Donna and James have three children and a dog. I have a feeling this vacuum will come in handy.

post_text: Happy Birthday Lions Club International!!!! You are now 100!!!! Melvin Jones founded Lions Club International on June 7th, 1917. The Lions Club is the largest service organization in the world. We in the Lions of Seaford are happy to do our part as good citizens and to help to those who are vision challenged. Today, we are flying flags in the heart of Seaford to celebrate our birthday. Thank you to Schmitt Funeral Home and Lions Charlie and Curt Schmitt for flying our flag. We are proud that it is flying beneath "Old Glory." We are privileged that it hangs in the Schmitt courtyard which is dedicated to our Armed Service and is rather beautiful. Thanks also to the Seaford Library and Lion Frank McKenna for flying our centennial flag in their lobby. I like to say that "it is great to be a Lion." It is.

At the October 4th Seaford Lions Meeting, we were fortunate to have Tim Jaccard as our guest speaker. Timothy Jaccard is a full-time Nassau County Police Ambulance Medical Technician. He has dedicated his life to saving as many children as he can from succumbing to the desperate act or their birth parents who do not know what else to do. Timothy Jaccard is the Founder and President of the AMT Children of Hope Foundation. He works endlessly and passionately to educate and prevent the abandonment of infants. This program has Been adopted throughout the nation. Tim is now working internationally to save infants.
Tim and the City of Hope foundation work hard with many different agencies and media to educate the public that throwing away an unwanted infant is not an option. Since the Foundation started focusing on prevention of infanticide and enabling Safe Havens to give options to desperate birth parents, they have save the lives of many children. Keep up the good work Tim.
Pictured here are Lion President Nancy Kohler and Tim

post_text: Congratulations to Lion Nancy Kohler. At the Long Island Award Ceremony held June 12th at LIJ Valley Strream Lion Nancy was awarded a "Tranporter Award" from Long Island Eye Bank. In a little over a year Lion Nancy has transported over 100 corneas to help those who are sight impaired get vision. Pictured left to right are "First Sister" Lion Donna Kohler, Eye Bank Technician and Seaford Lions member Lion Lorraine LoRe, RN, Seaford President elect Lion Nancy Kohler and proud mom Jean Kohler. Ladies, thank you all for your service to help others.
